name: claim
doc: Centralizes all the information, contacts, and business activities associated with a claimant's loss. The Claim entity is the primary object in the claim data model

fields.name: record_validfrom
fields.doc: PK - System field

fields.name: record_operation
fields.doc: System field

fields.name: claimkey
fields.doc: PK - cc_claim.PublicID

fields.name: exposurekey
fields.doc: PK - Unique identifier from source, part of the PK.

fields.name: sourcesystemcode
fields.doc: PK - The code associated with the source system that the record came from

fields.name: accidentyear
fields.doc: Would normally be the calendar year of the ‘date of loss’ (DOL) but in the case of ‘Claims Made’ (CM) type policies, this would be the original notification date by the assured/reassured (Direct/RI) and NOT necessarily the date advised to Enstar

fields.name: policynumber
fields.doc: Unique policy number, also known Policy Reference or Underwriting Reference

fields.name: coveragereference
fields.doc: Coverage reference identifies unique coverages on a policy section, a section may contain multiple coverages. There is no data dictionary definition for this

fields.name: sectionreference
fields.doc: Section reference identifies a unique section on a policy, a policy may contain multiple sections. There is no data dictionary definition for this

fields.name: claimantkey
fields.doc: FK to Contact for the claimant

fields.name: claimantname
fields.doc: Name of claimant

fields.name: claimantfirstname
fields.doc: Claimants first name

fields.name: claimantlastname
fields.doc: Claimants last name

fields.name: claimantreferencenumber
fields.doc: Unique Reference for the Claimant

fields.name: claimclosedate
fields.doc: The date a claim is either closed or re-closed

fields.name: claimcoveragecode
fields.doc: PK - Unique identifier from source

fields.name: claimcoveragedescription
fields.doc: Claim coverage description

fields.name: claimcreateddate
fields.doc: The date on which the claim is created/opened in the Claims Administration System

fields.name: claimdescription
fields.doc: Free format field used to describe the claim

fields.name: claimreopendate
fields.doc: The date a claim is re-opened

fields.name: claimreopenedreasoncode
fields.doc: The reason code for why a claim is re-opened

fields.name: claimreopenedreasondescription
fields.doc: The description as to why a claim is re-opened

fields.name: claimreporteddate
fields.doc: The date a claim was reported

fields.name: claimsectiondescription
fields.doc: Description associated with the type of section for the claim e.g. Description for: General Aviation to Hull; Liability, Casuality International; to Public & Products, Professional Liability. Also known as minor class description

fields.name: closedoutcomecode
fields.doc: Code pertaining to the closure of the Loss Section

fields.name: commutationeffectivedate
fields.doc: The effective date of the commutation

fields.name: commutationreleaseagreementdate
fields.doc: The date of the Commutation Release Agreement

fields.name: commutationstatus
fields.doc: Commutation is a settlement agreement reached between a reinsured and a reinsurer by which the reinsurance obligation is terminated by an agreement by the reinsurer to pay funds at present value that are not yet due under the reinsurance agreement

fields.name: currencydescription
fields.doc: The date on which the claim is first made in writing against the insured. In a claims-made setting, the insured could become aware of a potential loss in one policy period, but the claim could first be made in writing in a subsequent policy period

fields.name: dateoflossfrom
fields.doc: The date when the loss occurred. The 'from' date is the first date of loss. In the event of a catastrophe, the date of loss can span over a number of days. If the date if loss is a single date, then the 'from' and 'to' dates will be the same date

fields.name: dateoflossto
fields.doc: The date when the loss occurred. The 'to' date is the last date of loss. In the event of a catastrophe, the date of loss can span over a number of days If the date if loss is a single date, then the 'from' and 'to' dates will be the same date

fields.name: dateofnotificationtoinsured
fields.doc: The date when the insured first became aware of the loss. This date could be the date the insured was served notice of legal proceedings, when the insured was approached by a claimant or when the loss was first observed

fields.name: exposuretypecode
fields.doc: PK - Unique identifier from source

fields.name: incidenttypecode
fields.doc: PK - Unique identifier from source

fields.name: lineofbusinesscode
fields.doc: Code associated with how the business is classified in the source policy administration system for the policy

fields.name: lineofbusinessdescription
fields.doc: Description associated with how the business is classified in the source policy administration system for the policy

fields.name: legacyclaimnumber
fields.doc: The original claim number from the legacy data source. There may be more than one per claim

fields.name: losscausecode
fields.doc: Code associated with the cause of the loss (e.g. Fire, Road Collision, Loss of Arm). This can be aggregated up into Loss Types

fields.name: losslocationgeographycode
fields.doc: The place where the loss occurred

fields.name: lossreportdate
fields.doc: The date on which the claim was first notified to us

fields.name: losstypecode
fields.doc: Code associated with the type of loss incurred (e.g. Material Damage, Goods in Transit, Injury). This can be further split out into Loss Causes

fields.name: naicannualstatementlineofbusinesscode
fields.doc: Annual Statement Lines of Business (ASLOB) reported for National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) for the Claim Coverage

fields.name: notificationyear
fields.doc: Year when the loss was notified

fields.name: reservesegmentcode
fields.doc: The code relating to the reserve segment

fields.name: status
fields.doc: The status of the claim (e.g. open, closed, re-opened, re-closed)

fields.name: sublineofbusinesscode
fields.doc: The code associated with the Company's Sub Line of Business applicable to the risk

fields.name: sublineofbusinessdescription
fields.doc: The description associated with the Company's Sub Line of Business applicable to the risk

fields.name: uniqueclaimreference
fields.doc: The unique London Market reference associated with the claim
